name: Popurls Classic Black Style 2016
description: Brings back Popurls classic black theme - this userstyle is intended as a lite version of the full userscript @ https://greasyfork.org/en/scripts/14800-popurls-classic-black-style-2016 which more perfectly restores and improves on former site functionality while also adding fullsize image previews.
additional_info:
All colors and styles are an *exact* re-creation of the original site, the css values were copied from a locally saved html backup file that I found on my hard drive, dated 2014, from the original popurls.com black site.
    Updated list of userstyle modifications:
  • original background #0E0E0E
  • original font size 0.9em
  • original a { link, visited, hover, active } link colors
  • original article divider lines color
  • resized article thumbnails to fit original line spacing
  • inverted main graphics colors to work with black theme, i.e. from current white to original black background
  • inverted popurl main logo colors
  • inverted column header banner colors
In addition to the above, the userscript version @ https://greasyfork.org/en/scripts/14800-popurls-classic-black-style-2016 also contains:
    Updated list of modifications:
  • classic black favicon.ico - found original file still on popurls.net (related site), converted to base64 string
  • original background hover color behavior, the current white theme removed hovers
  • introduced fullsize improved popup image functionality to adjust for resized thumbnails
  • restored classic 'More' links using - the original image file still hosted on popurls server
  • improved qTips text popup tooltips going from 'default' to 'light rounded' theme - using external css file hosted on cdn
  • added toggle feature 'expand all news feeds' to permanently display news feed columns expanded or collapsed
If you choose to use the userstyle instead of the userscript, then an image-zoom browser addon is highly recommended so you can view the thumbnail images which are still the original fullsized images but html reduced to thumbnail-size.
